abstract.text: Some components can be used for

inlineContent.text: controls

abstract.text: and

inlineContent.text: inputs
The library proposes layout to add in your views some checkboxes components, even if this type of component is not iOS-native one.
You can use a simple checkbox without any labels and images using
This checkbox can provide two values (selected and unselected) or three values (selected, unselected and indeterminate) with

code: // A simple checkbox, with only an indicator
// The component must be instanciated with a string parameter used as accessibility label that will be
// The isOn parameter can have only two values: true (selected), false (unselected)
// The selection parameter can have only three values: selected, unselected and indeterminate

inlineContent.text: The library proposes also a checkbox which has in its layout some labels and icons.
The indicator can be leading or trailing.
It can be be used for two-states (
) or three-states management (

code: // A leading checkbox with a label, with only two states
// A leading checkbox with a label, an helper text, and exposing a three-values-based state with selection binding
// A trailing checkbox with a label, an helper text, an icon, a divider and is about an error
// with a reversed layout, and exposing only two states through isOn binding
label: "We live in a fabled world",
description: "Of dreaming boys and wide-eyed girls",

inlineContent.text: Checkboxes can be embeded in a checkbox picker (
) so as to let the users to select one or more items within several.

code: // Define the elements to display in checkboxes using OUDSCheckboxPickerData.
// This object has the same properties as the OUDSCheckboxItem,
// and some of them are optional with default values set
// Prepare the selection, with a value previously selected
// Use the data and the binding for the picker.
@State var selections: [String] = ["Choice_1"] // or empty if nothing selected
// Here the picker is vertical by default
// The picker can be vertical and have a root item with a label and a counter
// The picker can apply some settings to all its radio buttons.
// It can be also horizontal with a scroll indicator.
// Here all the the checkboxes are in read only mode and use reversed layout.
// Here the picker is horizontal and shows the scroll indicator

inlineContent.text: The library proposes layout to add in your views some radio buttons components, even if this type of component is not iOS-native one.
You can use a simple radio without any labels and images thanks to

code: // A simple radio, with only an indicator
// The component must be instanciated with a string parameter used as accessibility label that will

inlineContent.text: The library proposes also a radio which has in its layout some labels and icons (
The indicator can be leading or trailing.

code: // A leading radio with a label
OUDSRadioItem(isOn: $isOn, label: "Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds")
// A trailing radio with a label, an additional label, a descrption, an icon, a divider and is about an
label: "Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds",

inlineContent.text: Radio items can be embeded in a radio picker so as to let the users to select only one item within several (

code: // Define the elements to display in radio buttons using OUDSRadioPickerData.
// This object has the same properties as the OUDSRadioItem,
// and some of them are optional withdefault values set
// Prepare the selection, with a value previously selected
// Use the data and the binding for the picker.

inlineContent.text: The library proposes a new layout for the switch component. The native one is not used.
You can use a simple switch without any labels and images thanks to the

code: // A simple switch, with only an indicator
// The component must be instanciated with a string parameter used as accessibility label that will be
// The isOn parameter can have only two values: true (selected), false (unselected)

inlineContent.text: The library proposes also a switch which has in its layout some labels and icons (
The indicator can be leading or trailing.

code: // A leading switch with a label and exposing the state through isOn binding
// A leading switch with a label and a description
// A trailing switch with a label, a description, an icon, a divider and is about an error
OUDSSwitchItem("We live in a fabled world",
description: "Of dreaming boys and wide-eyed girls",

inlineContent.text: The library proposes suggestion (
) chip component to make some predicitve or recommended selection.

code: OUDSSuggestionChip(icon: Image("ic_heart"), accessibilityLabel: "Heart") { /* the action to process */ }
OUDSSuggestionChip(icon: Image("ic_heart"), text: "Heart") { /* the action to process */ }

inlineContent.text: The library proposes filter chip component (
) to make some filtering with selected or unselected options.

code: // Filter chip with icon only as selected
OUDSFilterChip(icon: Image("ic_heart"), accessibilityLabel: "Heart", selected: true) { /* the action to process */ }
// Filter chip with text only as not selected
// Filter chip with text and icon layout an in selected state
OUDSFilterChip(icon: Image("ic_heart"), text: "Heart", selected: true) { /* the action to process */ }

inlineContent.text: The library proposes a chip picker (
) to make easily filtering with two kinds of selection:
single or none
: to select or unselect one option only
single
: to select at least one option
multiple
: to select several options

code: // Define the elements to display in filter chip using OUDSChipPickerData.
// MARK: - Simple selection, one or zero
// Prepare the selection, with a value previously selected
// Use the data and the binding for the picker.
// Here the picker with title, selection and data
OUDSChipPicker(title: "Select a drink", selection: $selection, chips: someDataToPopulate)
// Prepare the selection, with a value previously selected
// Use the data and the binding for the picker.
// Here the picker with title, selection and data
OUDSChipPicker(title: "Select a drink", selection: $selection, chips: someDataToPopulate)
// Prepare the selection, with a value previously selected
// Use the data and the binding for the picker.
// Here the picker with title, selection and data
OUDSChipPicker(title: "Select a drink", selections: $selections, chips: someDataToPopulate)

inlineContent.text: The library provides a password input based on a
to let user provides password in a secure text field.

code: // The password to display and edit
// A basic password input with label
// Add a leading icon and helper text to more context
OUDSPasswordInput(label: "Password", password: $password, lockIcon: true, helperText: "Your password must be between 8 and 20 characters long.")

inlineContent.text: The library provides useful components for forms like
to let user write text data and be helped if needed.
Such components can have or not a leading icon or a trailing action with or without placeholders.

code: // The text to display and edit
// Empty text with prefix and suffix
// Add a leading icon for more context
OUDSTextInput(label: "Email", text: $text, placeholder: "firstName.lastName", suffix: "@orange.com", leadingIcon: Image(systemName: "envelope"))
// Add a trailing button with local image named "ic_cross" for additional action
let trailingAction = OUDSTextInput.TrailingAction(icon: Image("ic_cross"), actionHint: "Delete") { text = "" }
helperText: "The email will be automatically completed with @orange.com")

abstract.text: Radio button is a UI element that allows to select a single option from a set of mutually exclusive choices.
Radio button that does not show icon or text, provides greater flexibility when creating other components that require a Radio button to be displayed.

component_switch_Wireframe.alt: A switch component in light and dark modes with Wireframe theme

abstract.text: Switch item is a UI element that allows to toggle between two states, typically “On” and “Off”, and used to enable or disable features, options or settings.
Switch Item covers a wider range of contexts by allowing to toggle the visibility of additional text labels and icon assets.

abstract.text: A picker allowing to expose several checkboxes and select some of them within the others.
Each checkbox contains a “tag”, i.e. a supposed to be unique value.
The picker will expose the choosen values using this “tag”.
It has also some configuration elements which will override the one applied to nested
(divider, read only and error mode, layout and outlined)

Each radio button contains a “tag”, i.e. a supposed to be unique value.
The picker will expose the choosen value through this “tag”.
It has also some configuration elements which will override the one applied to nested
(divider, read only and error mode, layout and outlined)

abstract.text: Text input is a UI element that allows to enter, edit, or select single-line textual data.
Text input is one of the most fundamental form elements used to capture user input such as names, emails, passwords, or search queries.
It provides a visual and interactive affordance for text entry while supporting labels, placeholders, icons, descriptions, and validation feedback.

abstract.text: Filter chip is a UI element that allows to select or deselect an option within a series, and is commonly used to capture filtering decisions.
Filter chip allows to filter content by being selected or deselected.
It can be toggled “On” or “Off” to refine displayed results, and selected Filter Chips remain visually distinct to indicate active filters.

component_radio_Orange.alt: A radio button component in light and dark modes with Orange theme

abstract.text: Suggestion chip is a UI element that allows to present recommended or predictive options based on user’s input or context,
and is commonly used to capture filtering decisions.
Suggestion chip is typically non-selected by default and can be tapped or clicked to apply the suggestion, streamlining input and enhancing usability.
Chips can show multiple interactive elements together in the same area, such as a list of selectable movie times, or a serie of email contacts.
Best suited for category-based filters that do not require additional visual elements.
